Title: ARC ABMVIZ
SideBarTextLeft: ActivityViz was initially funded by the Atlanta Regional Commission with additional support from Oregon Metro and others.
SideBarTextRight: ActivityViz is an interactive travel and activity data visualization tool. It is built with JavaScript technologies and works with various types of travel and activity data - household travel surveys, trip-based model outputs, activity-based model outputs, disaggregate passive data, freight models, on-board surveys, etc. The dashboard features several interactive and customizable visualizations for exploring data, such as 3D maps of trips in time and space, time use by person type and activity, radar charts for performance measure analysis, sunburst diagrams for visualizing mode shares, animated bubble maps, chord diagrams for OD data, point-of-interest maps for transit stop data, truck flow data, etc. ActivityViz is published using GitHub pages which eliminates most of the administrative backend in traditional systems.

BarMap.name: Trip Mode
BarMap.title: Trip Mode by County
BarMap.info: Frequency of Trips by Mode by County

content: Frequency of trips by mode by county.
Fulton county has the largest share of transit trips.
For the left graph: Select/deselect bubbles to add/remove modes.
For the left graph: Hover mouse over graph to see detail.
For the map: Use the zone drop-down selection to view different trip modes as county colors.
For the map: Turn on bubbles under layers and use the bubbles drop-down selection to view different trip modes by county.
Select "Show Data" to see tabulation.

3DMap.name: Daytime Population
3DMap.title: Population not at Home by Time of Day
3DMap.info: People that are not in their home zone by time-of-day

content: Frequency of persons not at home by Transportation Analysis Zone (TAZ).
As the day progresses, people leave home, go to work, school, and other locations, and then return home in the evening.
Use the cycle through day button to animate the map.
Select "Show Data" to see tabulation.

datafilecolumns.PERSONS NOT AT HOME: Number of people not at home per zone and period

GroupedCharts.name: Day Patterns
GroupedCharts.title: Person Group by Day Pattern
GroupedCharts.info: Day patterns by person groupings

content: Day patterns by person type (e.g., employment status, student status, age)
Hover mouse over bars to see detail.
Select "Show Data" to see tabulation.

datafilecolumns.DAY PATTERN: Can be Home, Mandatory and Non-Mandatory
datafilecolumns.CHART: Which grouped chart they belong too

TimeUse.name: Time Use
TimeUse.title: Activity by Time of Day
TimeUse.info: Displays person out-of-home travel purpose by time of day. The vertical axis displays the sum or percent of activity and the horizontal axis displays the period of the day.

content: Activity by time of day
Derived from trip purpose and time at destination
Persons tend to be at home or work in the morning versus home, work, or other in the afternoon.
Hover mouse over bars to see detail by person type.
Select "Show Data" to see tabulation.
Select/deselect bubbles to add/remove trip purposes.

datafilecolumns.QUANTITY: Number of trips for specific purpose and person classification

Sunburst.name: Nested Mode Share
Sunburst.title: Trip Mode Share
Sunburst.info: Nested Trip Mode Share.  Click a ring area to drill-down into the nest.  Click the center to go back up the nest.

content: Nested trip mode share
Majority of travel done by auto modes.
Click a ring area to drill-down into the nest.
Click the center to go back up the nest.
Click a legend entry to select just that mode
Select "Show Data" to see tabulation.

RadarCharts.name: Performance Measures
RadarCharts.info: Activity centers by four performance measures.  The min/max by measure is scaled to the zone with the highest and lowest value.

content: Activity centers by four performance measures.
The min/max by measure is scaled to the zone with the highest and lowest value.
For example, City Center does well for transit mode share and accessible employment.
Each radar chart shows the activity center score for each measure.
Activity centers can be compared across charts by comparing chart area.
Select "Show Data" to see tabulation.
Rail station boardings.
Includes airport trips in addition to non-airport trips by time-of-day.
Five points has the most boardings
For the left graph: Select/deselect bubbles to add/remove time periods.
For the left graph: Hover mouse over graph to see detail.
For the map: Use the drop-down selection to view different point values and time periods.
For the map: Color the points by scaled data value size.
Select "Show Data" to see tabulation.

Chord.name: Trip ODs
Chord.title: Trip Flows by District, Purpose, and Mode
Chord.info: Trips by purpose and mode between super districts.

content: Origins and destinations of daily trips by district, trip purpose, and travel mode.
Hover mouse over graph to see detail.
Toggle trip types and modes to see trips on chord diagram
The connections between districts depict bi-directional flows.
Turn on desire lines in the map layers to see district-to-district trip flow lines
Select "Show Data" to see tabulation.

Hover mouse over bars to see detail.

datafilecolumns.DAY PATTERN: Can be Home, Mandatory and Non-Mandatory
datafilecolumns.CHART: Which grouped chart they belong too

TimeUse.name: Time Use
TimeUse.title: Activity by Time of Day
TimeUse.info: Displays person out-of-home travel purpose by time of day. The vertical axis displays the sum or percent of activity and the horizontal axis displays the period of the day.

content: Activity by time of day
Derived from trip purpose and time at destination
Persons tend to be at home or work in the morning versus home, work, or other in the afternoon.
Hover mouse over bars to see detail.
Select "Show Data" to see tabulation.
Select/deselect bubbles to add/remove trip purposes.

datafilecolumns.QUANTITY: Number of trips for specific purpose and person classification

Sunburst.name: Nested Mode Share
Sunburst.title: Trip Mode Share
Sunburst.info: Nested Trip Mode Share.  Click a ring area to drill-down into the nest.  Click the center to go back up the nest.

content: Nested trip mode share
Majority of travel done by auto modes.
Click a ring area to drill-down into the nest.
Click the center to go back up the nest.
Click a legend entry to select just that mode
Select "Show Data" to see tabulation.

RadarCharts.name: Performance Measures
RadarCharts.info: Activity centers by four performance measures.  The min/max by measure is scaled to the zone with the highest and lowest value.

content: Activity centers by four performance measures.
The min/max by measure is scaled to the zone with the highest and lowest value.
For example, City Center does well for transit mode share and accessible employment.
Each radar chart shows the activity center score for each measure.
Activity centers can be compared across charts by comparing chart area.
Select "Show Data" to see tabulation.
Rail station boardings.
Includes airport trips in addition to non-airport trips by time-of-day.
Five points has the most boardings
For the left graph: Select/deselect bubbles to add/remove time periods.
For the left graph: Hover mouse over graph to see detail.
For the map: Use the drop-down selection to view different point values and time periods.
For the map: Color the points by scaled data value size.
Select "Show Data" to see tabulation.

Chord.name: Trip ODs
Chord.title: Trip Flows by District, Purpose, and Mode

content: Origins and destinations of daily trips by district, trip purpose, and travel mode.
Hover mouse over graph to see detail.
Toggle trip types and modes to see trips on chord diagram
The connections between districts depict bi-directional flows.

Select "Show Data" to see tabulation.

GroupedCharts.name: Trip Os or Ds
GroupedCharts.title: Trip Origins or Destinations in MARTA Service Area
GroupedCharts.info: Frequency of Trips by origin or destination by super districts

content: Frequency of trips by origin or destination by super districts.
For the left graph: Select/deselect bubbles to add/remove modes.
For the left graph: Hover mouse over graph to see detail.
For the map: Use the zone drop-down selection to view different trip modes as county colors.
For the map: Turn on bubbles under layers and use the bubbles drop-down selection to view different trip modes by county.
Select "Show Data" to see tabulation.

Chord.name: Trip Flows
Chord.title: Trip Origins or Destinations in MARTA Service Area
Chord.info: Trip Origins or Destinations in MARTA Service Area.

content: Origins and destinations of daily trips by district in Fulton and DeKalb county.
Hover mouse over graph to see detail.
Toggle trip types and modes to see trips on chord diagram
The connections between districts depict bi-directional flows.
Turn on desire lines in the map layers to see district-to-district trip flow lines
Select "Show Data" to see tabulation.
